page.title: 04Lambing
page.content: In the year{1985},lambing on the {Rushmore}Estate took place in{late {April}and{early May}.We interviewed {Mr.Conio}and his assistant who were reaching the end of the lambing period.A caravan was parked by the lambing pens so that they could sleep when possible. On the estate there are{1500 ewes}and about{300 rams}are brought down from {Scotland}.The breed of sheep is{Mules} and they expect{2500 lambs.}The reason why lambing is so late is that the grass is in short supply. About {2%}of the lambs do not survive ,this is considered a{high}percentage when the lambs reach a good weight they are sent off to the {slaughter {house}. Being a shepherd is a tough job because the hours are long. {(AUTHORS:H.Davies,F.Lindsay,K.Rose)
